meta.title: Archive - Lower Merion School District

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasLeftBanner fsHasFooter fsHasTwoColumnWideLeftLayout fsSection137 fsHasTheme2 district

div.p: LMSD | Enter to Learn, Go Forth to Serve

input.name: q
input.title: search
input.style: width: 100%; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: -0.0625em 0px 0px; height: 1.25em; outline: none;

div.div: Enter to Learn, Go Forth to ServeThe District's motto, "Enter to Learn, Go Forth to Serve", forms the core of the District's vision statement and serves as a guiding principle for students and staff.

Agendas & Meeting Minutes For board meeting agendas and minutes, please visit our BoardDocs site.
Visit BoardDocs >>

A Qualified TeamThe District's professional staff consists of more than 630 full time teachers, 80% of whom have advanced degrees. The faculty is complemented by a support staff of more than 500 skilled individuals.

Academics Spotlight LMSD maintains one of the lowest class size averages in Pennsylvania. The student-to-professional staff ratio at the secondary level is 11:1 and average class size in the District is approximately 21 students.
Ten Schools of ExcellenceLMSD's six elementary schools, two middle schools and two high schools have all been recognized for excellence at the regional and national levels.

Our Community Lower Merion is a community characterized by a deep sense of civic pride and involvement -- and a passion for public education. In a recent survey, residents cited the community's convenient location and high-quality public schools as the two "best things about living in Lower Merion."

input.name: q
input.title: search
input.style: width: 100%; padding: 0px; border: none; margin: -0.0625em 0px 0px; height: 1.25em; outline: none;

li.a: Request the Use of an LMSD Facility

Religious Objection to the PSSA and Keystone Exams
EL Assessments, Placement and Exit Criteria

Academic Standards for English Language Arts
Strengthening Your Child's Reading at Home

div.class: fsElement fsNews fsPost fsThumbnailOriginal fsThumbnailSmall fsSingleItem

img.alt: New Free Meal Distribution Plan for LMSD Children

article.div: New Free Meal Distribution Plan for LMSD Children

div.p: Starting on Monday, March 23, 2020, the Suburban Square meal distribution site will be open on Mondays and Wednesdays ONLY from 11:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.

em.a: *In an effort to more accurately assess the number of meals that Nutritional Services will need to prepare, please pre-register by clicking here.*

div.p: Children will still be able to receive 10 meals per week. Thank you for your cooperation and flexibility as we work to minimize contact and maintain the health of our staff and community members.
Pickup Location: Parking lot at Montgomery & Anderson Avenues (across from former Ruby's location).

section.class: fsElement fsNews fsList fsItemCount_5 fsThumbnailOriginal fsThumbnailSmall

img.alt: Bala Cynwyd Staff Member's Handiwork Helping with PPE Shortage

div.a: Bala Cynwyd Staff Member's Handiwork Helping with PPE Shortage

div.p: Liz Miller decided to use her talents as a certified art and family consumer sciences teacher to lend a hand during the ongoing COVID-19 crisis.

article.a: Read more about Bala Cynwyd Staff Member's Handiwork Helping with PPE Shortage

img.alt: Harriton 9th Grade Social Entrepreneur Donates $1000 to Provide Meals for Underserved Children

div.a: Harriton 9th Grade Social Entrepreneur Donates $1000 to Provide Meals for Underserved Children

div.p: Anna Welsh's donation to Tree House Books, a giving library and literacy center in North Philadelphia, will supply 1000 meals to children.

article.a: Read more about Harriton 9th Grade Social Entrepreneur Donates $1000 to Provide Meals for Underserved Children

img.alt: LMSD Health Services Dept. Shares Important Tips on Staying Safe & Healthy

div.a: LMSD Health Services Dept. Shares Important Tips on Staying Safe & Healthy

div.p: The School Nurses took the opportunity to provide some helpful tips and reminders about how to stay safe and healthy - as well as how to keep OTHERS safe and healthy - while we continue to due our part to help flatten the curve.

article.a: Read more about LMSD Health Services Dept. Shares Important Tips on Staying Safe & Healthy

div.a: Change in Meal Distribution This Week

div.p: Due to potential danger from the storm and high winds forecasted for Monday, April 13, 2020, Monday's scheduled meal distribution will be postponed until Tuesday, April 14, 2020.

article.a: Read more about Change in Meal Distribution This Week

div.p: Gov. Tom Wolf, in consultation with Education Secretary Pedro Rivera and Health Secretary Rachel Levine, announced that all Pennsylvania schools will remain closed through the end of the 2019-2020 school year due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

article.a: Read more about April 9th Update from Superintendent Copeland
